title: 820-3437-b green light no power
message:
Hello, i have an 820-3437 with green light on charger but no power.

All rails are present till PP3V3_S4. It doesnt show any sign of corrosion.

title: 820-3437-b green light no power
message:
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L, at same time.
If present. check for pulse at PM_SLP_S4/3_L.

Be aware, this board should restart 2 times before booting, when charger is connected.

title: 820-3437-b green light no power
message: Yes, i get pulses from  PM_PWRBTN_L,   PM_SLP_S4_L and  PM_SLP_S3_L  when triggering  SMC_ONOFF_L

title: 820-3437-b green light no power
message:
Then check if each bg coil pulse at same time.
Also check pins 7 & 3 of U1950.

title: 820-3437-b green light no power
message:
Coils pulsing:

L7320
L7310
L7630
L7430
L7520
L7130

Coils not pulsing:

L3095
L7701

Pin 7 of U1950 is pulsing but 3 is not (0v).

title: 820-3437-b green light no power
message: Check for pulse at pins 5 & 6 of U1950.

title: 820-3437-b green light no power
message: Pins 5 and 6 of U1950 are pulsing

title: 820-3437-b green light no power
message:
Then pin 3 MUST pulse too.
If not, change U1950.

title: 820-3437-b green light no power
message: Pin 3 is pulsing, my bad, i think the probes didnt reach well.

title: 820-3437-b green light no power
message:
Power cycles every 5 seconds, or just 1, or 2 pulses when connect charger?

Try starting in SMC bypass.

title: 820-3437-b green light no power
message:
Power cycles every 3 seconds indefinitely.

No power on with SMC Bypass.

title: 820-3437-b green light no power
message: Can you catch any pulse at PLT_RESET_L?

title: 820-3437-b green light no power
message: Yes, theres a pulse every 3 sec.

title: 820-3437-b green light no power
message:
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
Clean/remove J6100, if needed.
Try known good working BIOS.

title: 820-3437-b green light no power
message:
R6115 was giving me 380 ohms where it should be 15. I replaced it for a 15 one.

There was a trace missing from R6128 to R6123 and i soldered a wire, it has continuity now. 

I clenaed J6100 and it looks pretty, should i still replace it?

U6100 is recognized by the programmer. I reprogrammed the BIOS with one from another  820-3437.

Still not turning on.

I noticed wheni try to turn on SMC bypass the fan spins for a sec then stops, then again and again.

title: 820-3437-b green light no power
message:
You can remove J6100, if do not use it to flash U6100.

We have tested 3437 BIOS files posted on the forum for sure.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_vUaRGjasq1rYvM6pfckGOvb-ljLB7FT/view?usp=sharing[/URL]
Just in case...
